examples: Maybe this photograph will jog your memory.
You know, maybe that old guy was yanking our chain.
They've suffered a heart attack, maybe two.
If you're not prepared to handle the pressure, then maybe this job isn't for you.
Maybe I should take a leaf out of Rick's book and start coming in early every morning.
words.defineEn: used to show that you are uncertain about the occurrence, correctness, or truth of something
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để cho thấy rằng bạn không chắc chắn về sự xuất hiện, tính chính xác hoặc sự thật của một cái gì đó

examples: The overwhelming majority of Irish-Americans probably persuaded the administration that the cake was not worth the candle.
Probably the only one who can see the forest for the trees.
He probably got them off the back of a truck.
We should probably invest in a good home security system.
I can probably reach him on his mobile.
words.defineEn: used for saying that something is likely to happen or be the case
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nói rằng một cái gì đó có khả năng xảy ra hoặc là trường hợp

examples: He danced the issue around.
The goldfish in the bowl was swimming around happily.
One of them was glancing nervously around.
A bus appeared around the corner.
People around the world enjoy various forms of music as a universal language.
words.defineEn: on all sides of something or someone
words.defineVi: trên tất cả các mặt của một cái gì đó hoặc một ai đó

examples: Troops drove out the demonstrators.
Her true feelings were finally out in the open.
By that point in the argument, reason had gone out the window.
She knows the business inside out.
The jury is still out as concerns the location of the new station.
words.defineEn: outside a room, building, etc.
words.defineVi: bên ngoài một căn phòng, tòa nhà, v.v.

examples: The police closed in.
The mother gently cradled her newborn baby in her arms.
His partner left the table in a fit of pique.
In 2018 the party had 10 000 members.
The birds built their nest in the tree.
words.defineEn: into or inside of a place, object, or area
words.defineVi: vào hoặc bên trong một địa điểm, đối tượng hoặc khu vực

examples: The college also runs evening classes in bricklaying and joinery.
Other football stakeholders also got a share of the cake.
Adults were also at risk from epidemics.
The modest pace of economic growth has also kept the lid on price growth.
You can also get information on careers in social work from their website.
words.defineEn: used to introduce another fact or idea in addition to something already mentioned
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để giới thiệu một thực tế hoặc ý tưởng khác ngoài một cái gì đó đã được đề cập

examples: Our team actually won!
The mobile phone business was actually his bread and butter.
Actually, I wear several different hats.
It's actually an incredibly good deal!
Some of my patients are actually staring death in the face.
words.defineEn: used to show surprise when someone says something that is not true
words.defineVi: dùng để thể hiện sự ngạc nhiên khi ai đó nói điều gì đó không đúng sự thật

examples: Patience isn't exactly her strong suit.
I make that exactly $50.
Their life together hasn't exactly been a bed of roses.
The role isn't exactly a walk in the park.
At the age of 75, the singer is not exactly in the prime of his life!
words.defineEn: used to indicate that something is completely accurate or correct
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để chỉ ra rằng một cái gì đó là hoàn toàn chính xác hoặc chính xác

examples: Her skirt almost reached the ground.
Robins build nests almost anywhere.
She almost shouted bloody murder on top of her lungs.
The poor girl was almost beside herself.
The recent economic recovery was almost entirely led by exports.
words.defineEn: used to say that something is nearly the case but not completely
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nói rằng một cái gì đó gần đúng nhưng không hoàn toàn

examples: Before the recession, the country was on the pig's back, but the situation has changed greatly.
Geography can actually greatly affect the taste of coffee beans.
Together, these measures greatly slowed down population growth.
Soil acidity also greatly affects bone preservation.
During the 20th century, mass distribution greatly increased the popularity of milk chocolate.
words.defineEn: to a great amount or degree; very much
words.defineVi: đến một số lượng lớn hoặc mức độ; rất nhiều

examples: Winter brings a peaceful silence, especially after a fresh snowfall.
The cranberry pie at the bakery is absolutely delicious, especially with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
Women especially, are known to wear so many different hats, when it comes to our work and home life.
She's got a lot on her plate - especially with two new projects starting this week.
I usually like to be the person who holds down the fort, especially at work.
words.defineEn: used for showing that what we are saying is related to one thing or person more than others
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để cho thấy rằng những gì chúng ta đang nói có liên quan đến một điều hoặc người nhiều hơn những người khác

examples: Generally, the article reads very well.
He is generally miserable and never gets on top of his work.
Human nature is generally of such kind that it will choose a line of least resistance if that is at all possible, and loathe exertion beyond it.
You can generally tell when a student is trying to do a snow job.
Generally speaking, the press has given Jacobson a free ride.
words.defineEn: in a way that is true in most cases
words.defineVi: theo cách đó là đúng trong hầu hết các trường hợp

examples: The chairman's resignation finally brought matters to a head.
The negotiations between the two countries finally yielded a peace agreement.
My poor old car finally gave up the ghost.
Ours has finally given up the ghost.
Our efforts are finally paying dividends.
words.defineEn: after a long time, usually when there has been some difficulty
words.defineVi: sau một thời gian dài, thường là khi có một số khó khăn

examples: The local bus company only runs a skeleton service on Sundays.
Your arrogance only adds fuel to the fire Manfred.
The HR department only shared the employee's personal information on a need-to-know basis.
Our policy only allows for exchanges.
The carpet only reached halfway across the room.
words.defineEn: with anyone or anything else excluded
words.defineVi: với bất cứ ai hoặc bất cứ điều gì khác bị loại trừ

examples: Our cat has just had five kittens.
Just click the link below.
That piece of work just rejected my resume for the third time!
Just hold your horses, Bill!
Alan's explanation just muddies the issue!
words.defineEn: no one and nothing more
words.defineVi: không ai và không gì hơn

examples: Get a load of George over there.
The incident was over in a twinkle.
Buses take priority over other vehicles on the road.
People held handkerchiefs over their mouths.
The chef drizzled cream over the warm apple pie.
words.defineEn: across from one side to the other
words.defineVi: từ bên này sang bên kia

examples: But at least I got to third base with you.
At least we know where we stand with Steven now.
There were at least forty people at the party, some of them gatecrashers.
If I were in her place, I would have at least apologized.
We all met that wolf in sheep's clothing I guess at least once a life.
words.defineEn: even if nothing else is done or true
words.defineVi: ngay cả khi không có gì khác được thực hiện hoặc đúng

words.defineEn: in the end or after a lot of waiting
words.defineVi: cuối cùng hoặc sau rất nhiều chờ đợi

examples: Then again, some major thinkers are way ahead of the curve.
At this stage in the campaign, the Democratic candidate is way ahead of the pack.
The Japanese company is light years ahead of its European competitors.
The car ahead of me jumped the light.
The new smartphone is streets ahead of its predecessor, with a larger screen and more powerful processor.
words.defineEn: in position or direction that is further forward or in front of a person or thing
words.defineVi: ở vị trí hoặc hướng xa hơn về phía trước hoặc phía trước một người hoặc vật

examples: The railway line runs right past the house.
The clock says ten past two.
Not a single jot or tittle goes past the eye of the boss without her noticing.
The cat ran right past me and into the house.
His past comes back to hunt him when an old friend returns to his life.
words.defineEn: from one side of something to the other
words.defineVi: từ bên này sang bên kia

examples: That kick of yours could have easily made mincemeat of my face.
Ciphers are easily broken by the new wonder machines.
Memorizing important dates in history came easily to him in school.
He picked up the new language easily by listening to podcasts.
Booksellers should easily be able to move this biography of Lincoln.
words.defineEn: with no problem or difficulty
words.defineVi: không có vấn đề hoặc khó khăn

examples: The chef carefully arranged the arugula leaves on the plate as a beautiful garnish.
The child carefully planted caryopses of wildflowers in the garden.
The lioness carefully groomed her newborn baby.
Please drive carefully.
She carefully sprinkled sunflower seeds on top of her homemade bread dough.
words.defineEn: with a lot of care or attention
words.defineVi: với rất nhiều quan tâm hoặc chú ý

examples: The horse took the first fence well.
Generally, the article reads very well.
The car holds the corners very well.
The glue is taking well.
In this grim little episode, few people come out well.
words.defineEn: in a way that is right, good, or satisfactory
words.defineVi: trong một cách đó là đúng, tốt, hoặc thỏa đáng

examples: Memories of that day still bring a lump to his throat.
A major technological advancement like that is still light years away.
The child is still running a fever
Men still hold most positions of power in this country.
Our trip is still very much up in the air.
words.defineEn: up to now or the time stated
words.defineVi: cho đến bây giờ hoặc thời gian đã nêu

examples: Then again, some major thinkers are way ahead of the curve.
but then we hit trouble.
And then, on cue, the weather changed.
Things have changed dramatically since then.
Then the punishment of individuals invariably took account of the harm or damage done to the victim.
words.defineEn: after the thing mentioned
words.defineVi: sau khi điều được đề cập

examples: Sadly, new customers are being enticed by tempting promotions only to find the dice are loaded against them.
"The good die young," said the pastor sadly at Robert's funeral, for even at the age of 80, his kindness, faith and generosity made his passing feel far too soon.
I hired Jess only because she thinks quick on her feet, an attribute that you sadly do not possess.
She should have known better than to trust him again after he had already betrayed her once, yet sadly it is a silly fish that is caught twice with the same bait.
because, sadly, the groom died.
words.defineEn: used to express that something is sad, regrettable, or unfortunate
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thể hiện rằng một cái gì đó là buồn, đáng tiếc, hoặc không may

examples: The days passed slowly.
The day and night passed slowly.
The blades of the helicopter were turning slowly.
The old lady walked slowly with the support of her cane.
He slowly raised his head up.
words.defineEn: moving or doing something at a slow speed; not quickly
words.defineVi: di chuyển hoặc làm điều gì đó với tốc độ chậm; không nhanh chóng

examples: had a stab at surfing once
The committee meets once a fortnight.
My family goes on a vacation once a year.
She once went down that political rabbit hole.
I do aerobics once a week.
words.defineEn: for one single time
words.defineVi: cho một lần duy nhất

examples: They have to obtain dribs and drabs from wherever they can, including charity, to make up their weekly income.
Ethan cuts a dash wherever he goes with his sharp suits and stylish accessories, leaving a lasting impression.
Oh I'm letting it roll, wherever I go.
The medical school's graduates are considered to be the cream of the crop and can get jobs wherever they want to.
James has always been a ladies' man, effortlessly charming and attracting women wherever he goes.
words.defineEn: to, in, or at any place
words.defineVi: đến, trong, hoặc bất cứ nơi nào

examples: A work ill done must be twice done.
"I've done twice as much today as yesterday!"
You won't have to explain it to him twice.
These foods are potentially dangerous, yet nobody thinks twice before handing them out to their loved ones.
The dentist recommended that I brush my teeth twice a day and floss regularly.
words.defineEn: for two times
words.defineVi: hai lần

examples: He memorized her phone number so he could reach her anytime.
I always make a large batch of bolognese pasta sauce and freeze it in portions, so I can enjoy it anytime I want.
I could see that the market bubble was set to burst anytime, so I topped out while the getting was good.
Check out tips anytime.
An agreement can end anytime.
words.defineEn: at an unspecified time
words.defineVi: tại một thời điểm không xác định

examples: Sales are growing fast.
Things certainly move fast in the blogosphere.
He takes bends much too fast.
The fast runner won the race by a wide margin.
He's going too fast.
words.defineEn: in a rapid or quick way
words.defineVi: một cách nhanh chóng hoặc nhanh chóng
